wikipedia_page.main: William Paul (7 February 1866 – 23 October 1911) was a Scottish footballer who played for Partick Thistle and Scotland as a centre forward. He was capped three times by Scotland and scored five goals (including four in one match in 1890). He featured for Partick Thistle across three decades, with his statistics in competitive matches for the club standing at 127 goals in 218 appearances.
